message_1:
Suppose we want to encrypt the message "MATH" using Hill Cipher with the following key:

 $\begin{pmatrix} 9 & 4 \\ 5 & 7 \end{pmatrix}$

What would be the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATH" using the Hill Cipher with the given key, we first need to convert the letters into their numerical equivalents using the alphabetical index (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25). 

M = 12
A = 0
T = 19
H = 7

Now, we need to arrange these numbers into a matrix and multiply it by the given key matrix:

Message matrix:
$\begin{pmatrix} 12 & 19 \\ 0 & 7 \end{pmatrix}$

Key matrix:
$\begin{pmatrix} 9 & 4 \\ 5 & 7 \end{pmatrix}$

Now, multiply the message matrix by the key matrix:

$\begin{pmatrix} 12 & 19 \\ 0 & 7 \end{pmatrix} \times \begin{pmatrix} 9 & 4 \\ 5 & 7 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} (12 \times 9) + (19 \times 5) & (12 \times 4) + (19 \times 7) \\ (0 \times 9) + (7 \times 5) & (0 \times 4) + (7 \times 7) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 213 & 169 \\ 35 & 49 \end{pmatrix}$

Now, we need to reduce the elements of the resulting matrix modulo 26:

$\begin{pmatrix} 213 \mod 26 & 169 \mod 26 \\ 35 \mod 26 & 49 \mod 26 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 23 \\ 9 & 23 \end{pmatrix}$

Finally, convert the numerical values back into letters:

1 = B
23 = X
9 = J
23 = X

So, the encrypted message is "BXJX".
